Detailed Description

template<class T>
class SimpleBinaryTree< T >

Abstract class providing virtual methods for searchByKey(), search(), insert(), deleteNode() ...and the Destructor.

void SimpleBinaryTree< T >::destroy ( nodeType< T > *&  p  )  [inline, private]

Deallocates each node.
Sets p = NULL.

Destroy the given node and its children. Arguments: Reference to a nodeType<T>*

Parameters:
p (nodeType<T> *) The root node of the current sub-tree.
To destroy a binary tree, for each node we destroy its left subtree, then its right subtree. Then deallocate the node itself.
To destroy a binary tree, for each node we destroy its left subtree, then its right subtree. Then deallocate the node itself.
